document_data.name: Tin
document_data.mainbody: '''Tin''' was a silver-white metal used to make [[bronze]] and [[pewter]] alloys. It was found in many places throughout [[Toril]] and beyond.
document_data.Properties:
Pure tin weighed {{SI|455|pound|k|long=yes}} per {{SI|1|cubic foot|l|long=yes}}, with its various alloys tending to weigh a little less.{{Cite dragon/13/How Heavy Is My Giant|6}} Tin had a very low melting point of {{SI|451|F}}, low enough to be melted down in most ovens, and flash-melted by ''[[fireball]]'' and ''[[lightning bolt]]'' spells.{{Cite dragon/123/Fire for Effect!|33,5}} Prior to the [[Time of Troubles]], tin required a significant amount of progress on a [[psionicist]]'s part before it could be synthesized through ''[[molecular rearrangement]]''.

When left submerged in seawater, tin gained a green patina, and collected [[coral]] and [[barnacle]] growth.{{Cite dragon/250/Sunken Fortunes|65}}

Availability.Mining & Trade:
[[File:Tin Ore.png|thumb|''A piece of tin-bearing ore.'']]
The primary source of tin was the mineral ore [[wikipedia:cassiterite|cassiterite]],{{Cite dragon/152/In a Cavern, In a Canyon...|23}} known in the [[Realms]] as the [[precious stones|precious stone]] [[raindrop]]{{Cite dragon/72/Gems Galore|19}} and the [[ornamental stones|ornamental stone]] [[woodtine]],{{Cite dragon/72/Gems Galore|17}} mined by folk called "tinners".

* The [[dwarf|dwarves]] of the [[Great Rift]] mined tin from the settlement of [[Rimmator]].
* The dwarves of [[Clan Herlinga]] mined tin from the [[Hagga Shan]] mountains and sold the metal ingots to merchants from [[Naupau]] in [[Sossal]].
* In [[Kozakura]], the island of [[Tenmei]] had tin, [[copper]], and [[silver]] mines operated by [[korobokuru]], exported through [[Tanegawa]]. Nearby, the small island of [[Tanekashima]] also had a number of tin mines operated by [[korobokuru]].
* [[Gnome]]s often worked tin, especially when living among other races. They were skilled at etching and casting such metals.{{Cite dragon/269/The New Adventures of Volo: Hin Nobody Knows|86}}

document_data.History:
The realm of [[Asram]] had access to [[iron]] and tin, but lacked copper and [[zinc]] completely.

''Circa'' [[1367 DR]], [[Ashabenford]] was home to a [[Zhentarim]] spy, [[Arvien Blackhair]], who worked as a tinsmith and pewtersmith. 

A large number of the inhabitants of [[Tasseldale]] were craftsmen, and many of them were tinsmiths. They imported tin and other metals from places such as [[Sembia]] or [[Archendale]] and then exported the crafts made from them.

Around the same year, in the [[City of Brass]] on the [[Elemental Plane of Fire]], tin was often mined by [[slave]]s under command of their [[efreeti]] masters.{{AQ-time}}

The temples of [[U'Chan Gompa]] were decorated with hanging dragon sculptures made of tin.
